Batched settings updates (#9165): Applies multiple setting changes in one go, making saves faster and reducing UI flicker across Settings, Auto Approve, Command Execution, and MCP toggles. README badges render reliably (#9200): Switched to badgen.net so badges are consistently visible; Installs and Rating are clear at a glance.

Respect custom OpenRouter-compatible URLs everywhere (#8951): Ensures all OpenRouter-related operations (model lists, pricing, image generation, CSP checks) consistently use your configured custom base URL for better privacy, compliance, and predictable billing (thanks sstraus!). Prevent crashes from null streaming chunks (#9105): Handles provider responses with null choices arrays correctly, improving stability for long-running generations across MiniMax M2 Stable and other OpenAI-compatible endpoints. Stop unwanted context condensing on settings save (#9108): Saving settings no longer triggers early context condensing when your provider/model is unchanged, so active tasks retain history until thresholds are truly reached. Cloud/headless: prevent command_output from blocking (#9152): Non‑blocking behavior avoids stalled tasks and intermittent timeouts. Model switch re‑applies selected profile (#9181): Ensures task configuration stays in sync when switching providers/models. API Profiles apply immediately when provider/model unchanged (#9210): Updates headers, baseUrl, service tier, and reasoning budgets without requiring a model change. Auto‑approval honors MCP server state (#9199): Restores expected tool auto‑approval behavior (thanks bozoweed!). Issue Fixer reliability via REST + ProjectsV2 (#9207): Resolves sync errors and restores dependable triage. OpenAI (native) encrypted reasoning handling (#9231): Includes encrypted reasoning only when a reasoning effort is set and enforces medium‑only verbosity for gpt‑5‑chat‑latest to prevent invalid parameter errors (thanks politsin!). Roo Anthropic input token normalization (#9224): Prevents double‑counting cached tokens so usage metrics, cost estimates, and context calculations are accurate across providers.

Roo Code Cloud error logging (#9098): Captures richer context for failed requests (status codes, response bodies, and request details), making it easier to understand and resolve provider and configuration issues. IPC: send messages to the current task (#9149): Programmatically post text and images into an active task for automations and richer context. Context management terminology (#9206): Rename “sliding window” to “context management” and unify handling under a single entry point for clearer behavior and documentation alignment.

Stateless conversation continuity via OpenAI Responses API (#9203): Preserves context locally with encrypted reasoning items while requests remain stateless, improving privacy and reliability and simplifying behavior (no previous_response_id).
This release refines task and to-do workflows, improves Roo Code Cloud diagnostics, tightens OpenRouter routing, and delivers key stability fixes for long-running sessions.

The task header and to-do list now work together so you can see progress at a glance without juggling extra UI: Integrated to-dos directly into the task header so active work is always visible. Show only relevant to-do changes in chat instead of noisy full-list updates. Simplified header layout to reduce distractions while keeping key controls in reach.
documents.s: Integrated task header and to-do list

documents.t: Less caffeinated welcome animation (#9104): Smooths the Roo hover animation to be less distracting during long sessions while keeping the interface responsive.

Respect custom OpenRouter-compatible URLs everywhere (#8951): Ensures all OpenRouter-related operations (model lists, pricing, image generation, CSP checks) consistently use your configured custom base URL for better privacy, compliance, and predictable billing (thanks sstraus!). Prevent crashes from null streaming chunks (#9105): Handles provider responses with null choices arrays correctly, improving stability for long-running generations across MiniMax M2 Stable and other OpenAI-compatible endpoints. (Contributors: daniel-lxs) Stop unwanted context condensing on settings save (#9108): Saving settings no longer triggers early context condensing when your provider/model is unchanged, so active tasks retain history until thresholds are truly reached. (Contributors: daniel-lxs, hannesrudolph)

Improved Roo Code Cloud error logging to capture richer context (status codes, response bodies, and request details), making it easier to understand and resolve provider and configuration issues. (#9098)
This patch fixes OpenAI native encrypted reasoning handling, corrects Anthropic input token normalization, and cleans up context management terminology.

OpenAI native encrypted reasoning parameters: Restores usability of gpt-5-chat-latest by including encrypted reasoning only when a reasoning effort is set and enforcing medium-only verbosity to prevent invalid parameter errors (thanks politsin!) (#9231) Roo Anthropic token normalization: Prevents double-counting cached tokens so usage metrics, cost estimates, and context calculations are accurate across providers (#9224)

Terminology cleanup for context handling: Rename "sliding window" to "context management" and unify the code path under a single entry point, manageContext, for clearer behavior and documentation alignment (#9206)
此补丁改进了无状态对话连续性，加快了设置更新速度，并修复了 API 配置文件、Issue Fixer 和自动批准行为。
批量设置更新：在设置、自动批准、命令执行和 MCP 切换中，保存应用更快，UI 闪烁更少 (#9165) README 徽章：切换到 badgen.net，使徽章能够可靠渲染；安装量和评分一目了然 (#9200)
API 配置文件：即使提供商/模型保持不变，也会应用更新的标头、baseUrl、服务层级和推理预算 (#9210) 自动批准：包含 MCP 服务器状态，使工具自动批准按配置工作（感谢 bozoweed！） (#9199) Issue Fixer：迁移到 GitHub REST + ProjectsV2，以解决同步错误并恢复可靠的分类 (#9207)
通过加密推理项实现对话连续性（OpenAI Responses API）：在本地保留上下文，同时保持请求无状态，以获得更好的隐私性和可靠性；移除 previous_response_id 复杂性 (#9203)
Roo Code 3.32 combines GPT-5.1 model support and OpenAI Responses prompt caching with reliability fixes for OpenAI Native and native tool protocol.

GPT-5.1 in Roo Code (#9252, #9258, #9261, #9259) Adds the new GPT-5.1 models across supported providers, with extended 24‑hour prompt caching support in the OpenAI Native provider and improved overall software‑engineering performance.
documents.s: GPT-5.1 models and OpenAI prompt caching

documents.t: Share button works reliably again (#9253) Fixes the Share button so you can open the share popover and send shared tasks and messages without failures. Keep OpenAI Native reasoning stable during condensing (#9263) Keeps encrypted reasoning blocks paired with the assistant messages that produced them so OpenAI Native condensing no longer throws errors and long-running tasks with reasoning stay stable even as history is trimmed. Prevent duplicate tool_result blocks for read_file in native protocol (#9272) Ensures read_file emits exactly one tool_result per tool_call_id in native protocol, preventing 400 errors while still surfacing clear error messages to both the agent and the user. Fix duplicate tool blocks causing "tool has already been used" errors (#9275) Stops XML protocol runs from merging duplicate tool blocks into assistant messages so each tool block executes only once per turn and tool-driven tasks no longer get stuck behind false “tool has already been used” errors. Make OpenAI Native cancellation stop streaming immediately (#9276) Adds an abort controller so cancelling an OpenAI Native request stops streaming promptly, avoiding extra tokens after cancellation and reducing wasted usage. Disable XML parser for native tool protocol (#9277) Bypasses XML parsing when toolProtocol is set to native and relies on structured tool_call chunks instead, avoiding mis-parsed XML-like snippets and making native tool runs more reliable—especially for models that sometimes mix formats.
This patch improves reliability for OpenAI Native and native tool protocol by fixing reasoning handling, duplicate tool blocks, and cancellation behavior.

Keep OpenAI Native reasoning stable during condensing (#9263) Keeps encrypted reasoning blocks paired with the assistant messages that produced them so OpenAI Native condensing no longer throws errors and long-running tasks with reasoning stay stable even as history is trimmed. Prevent duplicate tool_result blocks for read_file in native protocol (#9272) Ensures read_file emits exactly one tool_result per tool_call_id in native protocol, preventing 400 errors while still surfacing clear error messages to both the agent and the user. Fix duplicate tool blocks causing "tool has already been used" errors (#9275) Stops XML protocol runs from merging duplicate tool blocks into assistant messages so each tool block executes only once per turn and tool-driven tasks no longer get stuck behind false “tool has already been used” errors. Make OpenAI Native cancellation stop streaming immediately (#9276) Adds an abort controller so cancelling an OpenAI Native request stops streaming promptly, avoiding extra tokens after cancellation and reducing wasted usage. Disable XML parser for native tool protocol (#9277) Bypasses XML parsing when toolProtocol is set to native and relies on structured tool_call chunks instead, avoiding mis-parsed XML-like snippets and making native tool runs more reliable—especially for models that sometimes mix formats.
This release adds GPT-5.1 models, enables OpenAI Responses prompt caching, fixes the share button, and improves release-note traceability.

GPT-5.1 in Roo Code (#9252, #9258, #9261, #9259): Adds all new GPT-5.1 models to the OpenAI Native provider with extended 24‑hour prompt caching support, all new GPT-5.1 models and overall support for 51 throughout other supported providers. Adaptive reasoning: GPT-5.1 includes adaptive reasoning that adjusts effort based on task complexity for faster and more efficient results. Better tone and instruction following: GPT-5.1 provides improved tone control and stronger instruction following so outputs match your brand voice more naturally. Stronger software engineering performance: GPT-5.1 delivers more reliable software engineering performance with better code generation, stronger edge case handling, and improved logic planning.
Share button works reliably again: Fixes the Share button so you can open the share popover and send shared tasks and messages without failures (#9253).
Release notes are easier to audit: The internal release guide now requires PR numbers in release notes so each documented change can be traced back to its source PR (#9236).
Roo Code 3.33 引入了对 Gemini 3 Pro Preview 的支持，以及对 OpenAI 兼容提供商的本地工具调用，同时改进了 Gemini 的默认设置，并修复了大量本地工具协议问题。

Roo Code 现在通过直接 Gemini、Vertex AI 以及 OpenRouter 和 Requesty 等聚合提供商支持 Google 的 Gemini 3 Pro Preview 模型 (#9357, #9327)： 100 万 token 的推理模型：能够处理超长对话，同时在复杂的编码和重构任务中提供高质量的多步推理。 强大的评估性能：在 Roo Code 内部评估中获得了 100% 的分数，在 SWE-bench Verified 中获得了 76.2% 的分数，在实际编码任务中提供更一致的解决方案。 可靠的工具使用：能够执行复杂的多步工具工作流，不会卡住或失去跟踪，尤其是在长时间、工具密集型的任务中。 更好的开箱即用默认设置：在支持的地方默认使用 gemini-2.5-pro，将温度设置为更自然的 1，清理 Gemini 模型列表，并在成本报告中包含推理 / “思考” token，使使用量数字更好地匹配提供商计费。 图像预览支持：添加了对 Google Gemini 3 Pro 图像生成模型的图像预览支持 (#9440)。

OpenAI 兼容提供商的本地工具调用 (#9369)：使支持 OpenAI 格式的更广泛模型和提供商能够使用本地工具，在流式和非流式模式下提供更强大的工具交互。 Minimax 提供商支持 (#9455)：添加了对 Minimax 作为 Anthropic 兼容提供商的支持。 推理历史记录 (#9451)：现在所有提供商的推理都会存储在对话历史记录中。 改进的读取文件工具 (#9422)：使用更清晰的示例增强了 read_file 工具描述。 环境详情中的 Git 状态 (#9310)：在环境详情中显示 git 状态信息，以便代理对未跟踪、已修改和暂存的文件有更多上下文。 高级设置中的工具协议选择器 (#9324)：让您选择要使用的工具协议（例如 XML 与本地），而无需编辑配置文件。 动态工具协议解析 (#9286)：使用清晰的优先级层次结构解析活动工具协议。 改进的模式视图工具栏 (#9077)：将导入/导出移动到模式视图工具栏，并清理模式编辑视图。 云代理 CTA 指向设置页面 (#9338)：更新云代理号召性用语，直接链接到设置页面。 Roo Code Cloud 提供商定价页面 (#9195)：添加定价页面以及相关的 Cloud 提供商调整。 Gemini 本地工具调用（实验性，仅限 Google Gemini 提供商） (#9343)：为 Google Gemini 提供商添加实验性本地工具选项（默认关闭），以便基于 Gemini 的工作流可以使用工具而无需 XML 转换，并表现得更像其他本地工具提供商。 扩展中的 Roo Code Cloud 信用余额 (#9386)：在 Roo 提供商设置中直接显示您的 Roo Code Cloud RCC 信用余额，以便您可以跟踪使用情况并避免意外中断。 免费模型的明确 0 定价 (#9419)：在定价 UI 中为免费模型显示明确的 0 输入/输出 token 价格，以便始终清楚哪些选项是免费的。

原生工具协议竞态条件 (#9363)：修复了切换配置文件或更改 API 配置时可能导致 400 错误的竞态条件问题。 原生工具重复检测 (#9377)：修复了重复使用原生工具时误报“陷入循环”错误的问题。 严格原生协议解析 (#9371)：确保在原生协议激活时不进行 XML 解析。 Gemini 推理配置 (#9375)：修复了高/低推理努力配置未正确应用的问题。 Gemini 思维验证 (#9380)：解决了与 Gemini 推理模型的集成错误。 防止原生协议中出现重复的 tool_result 块 (#9248)：确保每次原生工具调用仅生成一个 tool_result 块。 为原生协议格式化工具响应 (#9270)：规范化工具响应结构，便于模型理解。 集中管理 toolProtocol 配置检查 (#9279)：使用单一可信源管理 toolProtocol 配置。 在对话历史中保留工具块 (#9319)：确保原生协议工具块在历史记录中保持完整。 防止成功完成后陷入无限循环 (#9325)：修复了某些原生工具流程可能循环的回归问题。 同步解析器状态与配置文件和模型变更 (#9355)：保持对话解析器与当前配置文件和模型同步。 将工具协议传递给截断错误 (#9358)：确保截断错误能识别当前使用的工具协议。 结构化 JSON 返回 (#9373)：更新工具以在使用原生协议时始终返回结构化 JSON。 VS Code 主题色轮廓按钮边框 (#9336)：使轮廓按钮边框与当前 VS Code 主题保持一致。 使用 shields.io 徽章替代 badgen.net (#9318)：将失效的徽章 URL 替换为 shields.io。 限制评估中 git status 文件采样数量 (#9322)：在评估设置中为 git status 文件添加最大数量限制。 在原生工具调用结果中保留图像 (#9401)：确保附加到消息中的图像在原生工具调用中被保留并传递，以便后续推理仍能使用视觉上下文，而不会丢失为纯文本。 更快的路由器模型元数据加载 (#9410)：减少冗余的 getModel() 调用，并添加基于磁盘的元数据缓存，使基于路由器的提供程序启动更快，加载模型信息时更可靠。 环境详情重复 (#9442)：修复了恢复已取消任务时 environment_details 重复的问题。 保留推理标志 (#9453)：修复了 preserveReasoning 标志，使其能正确控制 API 推理内容的包含。 OpenAI 并行工具调用 (#9433)：防止在使用原生工具调用时触发 OpenAI 原生并行工具调用，以避免错误。 搜索和替换解析 (#9456)：改进了搜索和替换功能中的符号解析。 跳过的工具结果 (#9457)：修复了原生协议中跳过的工具未发送 tool_result 块的问题。 Markdown 格式化 (#9458)：改进了 Markdown 格式化并增加了推理支持。
此补丁版本主要关注 Gemini 原生工具调用，使 Roo Code Cloud 使用情况更加可见，明确哪些模型是免费的，并提高原生工具的可靠性和性能。

Gemini 原生工具调用（实验性，仅限 Google Gemini 提供商）：为 Google Gemini 提供商添加一个实验性选项，通过原生工具协议调用工具（默认关闭），这样依赖工具的基于 Gemini 的工作流可以更类似于其他原生工具提供商，而无需通过 XML 转换。 (#9343) 扩展中的 Roo Code Cloud 积分余额：登录后，直接在 Roo 提供商设置中显示您的 Roo Code Cloud RCC 积分余额，帮助您跟踪使用情况并避免意外中断。 (#9386) 免费模型的明确 0 定价：在定价 UI 中为免费模型的输入和输出令牌显示 0 价格，这样就能明显看出哪些选项是免费的，而不是留空价格。 (#9419)
保留原生工具调用结果中的图像：确保附加到消息的图像在原生工具调用中得以保留并传递给模型，这样后续推理仍然可以使用重要的视觉上下文，而不是仅以纯文本形式丢失。 (#9401) 更快的路由器模型元数据加载：减少冗余的 getModel() 调用，并为基于路由器的提供商添加磁盘缓存回退，使能力元数据在启动时可用，并减少加载模型信息时的延迟和不稳定性。 (#9410)

Gemini 3 Pro Preview is now available in Roo Code and already performing extremely well in real-world coding tasks, alongside 16 tweaks and fixes—thanks to everyone in the Roo Code community who helped shape this release.

Roo Code now supports Google’s Gemini 3 Pro Preview model through direct Gemini, Vertex AI, and aggregator providers like OpenRouter and Requesty (#9357, #9327): 1M-token, reasoning-capable model: Handles very large conversations while providing higher-quality multi-step reasoning on complex coding and refactoring tasks. Strong eval performance: Achieves a 100% score on internal Roo Code evals and 76.2% on SWE-bench Verified, giving more consistent solutions on real-world coding tasks. Reliable tool usage: Executes complex multi-step tool workflows without getting stuck or losing track, especially in long, tool-heavy tasks. Better out-of-the-box defaults: Uses gemini-2.5-pro by default where supported, sets a more natural temperature of 1, cleans up the Gemini model list, and includes reasoning / “thought” tokens in cost reporting so usage numbers better match provider billing.

Git status in environment details (#9310): Shows git status information in environment details so agents have more context about untracked, modified, and staged files when reasoning about your workspace. Tool protocol selector in advanced settings (#9324): Lets you choose which tool protocol to use (such as XML vs native) without editing config files, making it easier to experiment with different tool behaviors. Dynamic tool protocol resolution (#9286): Resolves the active tool protocol using a clear precedence hierarchy, so provider defaults, mode settings, and user overrides interact in a predictable way. Improved Modes view toolbar (#9077): Moves Import/Export into the Modes view toolbar and cleans up the Mode edit view, making it easier to manage and share modes from a single place. Cloud agent CTA points to setup page (#9338): Updates the cloud agent call-to-action to link directly to the setup page so new users can get started faster. Roo Code Cloud provider pricing page (#9195): Adds a pricing page and related Cloud provider tweaks so pricing is easier to understand before you enable Roo Code Cloud.

Prevent duplicate tool_result blocks in native protocol (#9248): Ensures each native tool call emits a single tool_result block, avoiding 400 errors and duplicated tool executions. Format tool responses for native protocol (#9270): Normalizes the structure of tool responses so native protocol runs are easier for models to follow and less likely to error. Centralize toolProtocol configuration checks (#9279): Uses a single source of truth for toolProtocol configuration, reducing configuration drift and subtle behavior differences. Preserve tool blocks in conversation history (#9319): Keeps native protocol tool blocks intact in history so follow-up turns can reason correctly about prior tool calls. Prevent infinite loops after successful finalization (#9325): Fixes a regression where certain native tool flows could loop after successful completion instead of stopping cleanly. Sync parser state with profile and model changes (#9355): Keeps the conversation parser aligned with the active profile and model so switching models or profiles does not leave the parser in an inconsistent state. Pass tool protocol to truncation errors (#9358): Ensures truncation errors know which tool protocol is active so error handling and messaging stay accurate. VS Code theme-colored outline button borders (#9336): Aligns outline button borders with the current VS Code theme for a more consistent UI. Use shields.io badges instead of badgen.net (#9318): Replaces broken badge URLs with shields.io so badges render reliably again. Cap git status file sampling in evals (#9322): Adds a maximum for git status files in eval settings so evaluations don’t pull excessively large environment details.
This release introduces native tool calling support for OpenAI-compatible providers, improves Gemini reasoning reliability, and fixes several native tool protocol issues.

Native Tool Calling for OpenAI-compatible Providers: Enables native tool use with a wider range of models and providers that support the OpenAI format, offering more robust tool interactions in both streaming and non-streaming modes (#9369)

Native Tool Protocol Race Condition: Fixed a race condition where switching profiles or changing API configuration could cause tool results to be formatted incorrectly, leading to 400 errors (#9363) Native Tool Repetition Detection: Fixed false positive "stuck in a loop" errors when using native tools repeatedly with different arguments (#9377) Strict Native Protocol Parsing: Ensured no XML parsing occurs when the native protocol is active, preventing model confusion (#9371) Prompt Cleanliness: Removed incompatible XML tool examples from the system prompt when native tool calling is enabled (#9367) Gemini Reasoning Config: Fixed an issue where high/low reasoning effort configuration was not being applied correctly (#9375) Gemini Thought Validation: Resolved integration errors with Gemini reasoning models by correctly handling thought signatures and token counting (#9380) Structured JSON Returns: Updated tools to consistently return structured JSON when using the native protocol (#9373)
This release introduces image preview support for Google Gemini 3 Pro, adds Minimax as a new provider, and includes several important bug fixes and quality of life improvements.
We've added support for image generation with Google Gemini 3 Pro image generation model (#9440)

Minimax Provider Support: Added support for Minimax as an Anthropic-compatible provider (#9455) Reasoning History: Reasoning is now stored in conversation history for all providers (#9451) Improved Read File Tool: Enhanced the read_file tool description with clearer examples (#9422)

Environment Details Duplication: Fixed an issue where environment_details were duplicated when resuming cancelled tasks (#9442) Preserve Reasoning Flag: Fixed the preserveReasoning flag to correctly control API reasoning inclusion (#9453) OpenAI Parallel Tool Calls: Prevented OpenAI Native parallel tool calls when using native tool calling to avoid errors (#9433) Search and Replace Parsing: Improved symbol parsing in the search and replace functionality (#9456) Skipped Tool Results: Fixed an issue where tool_result blocks were not sent for skipped tools in the native protocol (#9457) Markdown Formatting: Improved markdown formatting and added reasoning support (#9458)
Dependency Update: Updated glob dependency to ^11.1.0 (#9449) Dependency Update: Updated tar-fs to 3.1.1 via pnpm override (#9450)

Roo Code 3.34 combines Browser Use 2.0, the Baseten provider, OpenAI-compatible improvements, and refined onboarding and native tool descriptions with patches that add Roo Code Cloud eval support, clearer image generation prompts, todo list cleanup, cloud sync fixes, Claude Opus 4.5 across Roo Code Cloud, OpenRouter, Anthropic, and Vertex, AWS Bedrock embeddings for code indexing, improved native tool workflows for Mistral and OpenAI-compatible providers, smoother Anthropic tool streaming on OpenRouter, better Bedrock global inference selection, plus new provider reliability and model updates, free Black Forest Labs image generation on Roo Code Cloud, native MCP tool reliability fixes, native tool calling for Anthropic, Z.AI, and Moonshot providers, improved cloud sign-in experience, a race condition fix for the new_task tool on native protocol, and multiple bug fixes.

Browser Use now supports a more capable "2.0" experience (#8941): Richer browser interaction: Enables more advanced navigation and interaction patterns so Roo can better follow multi-step web workflows. More reliable automation: Improves stability for sequences of clicks, typing, and scrolling, reducing the chance of flaky browser runs. Better fit for complex sites: Makes it easier to work with modern web apps that require multiple steps or stateful interactions. 📚 Documentation: See Browser Use for details on how to enable and use browser workflows. Note: We have not yet updated these docs with images and a video of the new experience.

Provider-oriented welcome screen: Added a provider-focused welcome screen so new users can more quickly choose and configure a working model setup (#9484). Pinned Roo provider: Pinned the Roo provider to the top of the provider list so it is easier to discover and select (#9485). Clearer native tool descriptions: Enhanced built-in tool descriptions with examples and clarifications so Roo can choose the right tools and use them more accurately (#9486). Clearer image generation prompts: The full prompt and path for image generation now appear directly in the chat UI with clearer spacing and typography, making it easier to inspect, debug, and reuse prompts (#9505, #9522). Eval jobs on Roo Code Cloud: You can now run evaluation jobs directly on Roo Code Cloud models, reusing the same managed models and job tokens as regular cloud runs (#9492, #9522). XML tool protocol stays in sync with configuration: Tool runs that use the XML protocol now correctly track the configured tool protocol after configuration updates, preventing rare parser-state errors when switching between XML and native tools (#9535)). Experimental multiple native tool calls per turn with guardrails: Lets the native tool protocol run multiple tools in a single assistant turn and blocks attempt_completion() if any tool fails in that turn, reducing the risk of partial or incorrect completions (#9273). Web-evals dashboard enhancements with dynamic tool columns and UX improvements: Adds aggregate run statistics, per-tool success metrics, and dynamic tool usage columns so you can quickly spot failing tools or exercises and compare runs without rebuilding configs (#9592). Native tools as default for specific Roo Code Cloud models: Sets the providers’ native tool protocol as the default for minimax/minimax-m2 and anthropic/claude-haiku-4.5 on Roo Code Cloud to reduce configuration overhead and improve tool-calling reliability (#9586). Native tool calling for Mistral: Adds native tool calling support for the Mistral provider, enabling more reliable tool workflows and better multi-step automation when using Mistral models (#9625). Parallel native tool execution via OpenAI protocol: Wires the MULTIPLE_NATIVE_TOOL_CALLS experiment to OpenAI's parallel_tool_calls capability so multiple tools can run in parallel under the OpenAI-compatible protocol, improving throughput for tool-heavy tasks (#9621). Fine-grained tool streaming for OpenRouter Anthropic: Adds fine-grained tool streaming support for Anthropic models on OpenRouter so tool call responses stream more smoothly and stay aligned with Anthropic's tool semantics (#9629). Global inference selection for Bedrock with cross-region: Allows global inference to pick Bedrock models correctly even when cross-region routing is enabled, reducing the risk of mismatched regions or unavailable models during automatic selection (#9616). Improved Cloud Sign-in Experience: Adds a "taking you to cloud" screen with a progress indicator during authentication, plus a manual URL entry option as fallback for more reliable onboarding (#9652).

Streaming cancel responsiveness: Fixed the cancel button so it responds immediately during streaming, making it easier to stop long or unwanted runs (#9448). apply_diff performance regression: Resolved a recent performance regression in apply_diff, restoring fast patch application on larger edits (#9474). Model cache refresh: Implemented cache refreshing to avoid using stale disk-cached models, ensuring configuration updates are picked up correctly (#9478). Tool call fallbacks: Added a fallback to always yield tool calls regardless of finish_reason, preventing cases where valid tool calls were dropped (#9476). Single todo list in updates: Removed a redundant todo list block from chat updates so you only see one clean, focused list when the updateTodoList tool runs (#9517, #9522). Cloud message deduplication: Fixed cloud message syncing so duplicate copies of the same reasoning or assistant message are no longer re-synced, keeping task histories cleaner and less confusing (#9518, #9522). Gemini 3 reasoning_details support: Fixes 400 INVALID_ARGUMENT errors when using Gemini 3 models via OpenRouter by fully supporting the newer reasoning_details format, so multi-turn and tool-calling conversations now work reliably without dropping reasoning context (#9506)). Skip unsupported Gemini content blocks safely: Gemini conversations on Vertex AI now skip unsupported metadata blocks (such as certain reasoning or document types) with a warning instead of failing the entire thread, keeping long-running chats stable (#9537)). Native MCP tool names preserved in history: Native mode now keeps the real dynamic MCP tool names (such as mcp_serverName_toolName) in the API history instead of teaching the model a fake use_mcp_tool name, so follow-up calls pick the right tools and tool suggestions stay consistent (#9559). Native tools condensing keeps tool_use context: When condensing long conversations that use native tools, required tool_use and tool_result blocks are preserved in the summary message, preventing 400 errors and avoiding lost context during follow-up turns (#9582). API handler refresh on tool protocol changes: Ensures switching API profiles that only change the tool protocol still refreshes the underlying handler and parser so tool calls always use the correct configuration (#9599). Native tools file reading regression for Grok Code Fast: Restricts the single-file read behavior to XML tools so native tool calls use the standard multi-file-aware file reader and can access the workspace as expected (#9600). Roo Code Cloud embeddings revert and reliability: Removes Roo Code Cloud as an embeddings provider to prevent codebase_search from appearing when it is not configured and to avoid indexing getting stuck in a standby state (#9602). OpenRouter GPT-5 Schema Validation: Fixes schema validation errors when using GPT-5 models via OpenRouter with the read_file tool (#9633). write_to_file Directory Creation: Fixes ENOENT errors when creating files in non-existent subdirectories (thanks ivanenev!) (#9640). OpenRouter Tool Calls: Fixes tool calls handling when using OpenRouter provider (#9642). Claude Code Configuration: Fixes configuration conflicts by correctly disabling native tools and temperature support options that are managed by the Claude Code CLI (#9643). Race Condition in new_task Tool: Fixes a timing issue where subtasks completing quickly (within 500ms) could break conversation history when using the new_task tool with native protocol APIs (#9655).

Baseten provider: Added Baseten as a new AI provider, giving you another option for hosted models and deployments (#9461). OpenAI-compatible improvements: Improved the base OpenAI-compatible provider configuration and error handling so more OpenAI-style endpoints work smoothly without special tweaks (#9462). OpenRouter capabilities: Improved copying of model-level capabilities onto OpenRouter endpoint models so routing respects each model's real abilities (#9483). Roo Code Cloud image generation provider: Roo Code Cloud is now available as an image generation provider, so you can generate images directly through Roo Code Cloud instead of relying only on third-party image APIs (#9528)). Cerebras model list clean-up: The Cerebras provider model list now only shows currently supported models, reducing errors from deprecated Cerebras/Qwen variants and keeping the model picker aligned with what the API actually serves (#9527)). Reliable LiteLLM model refresh after credential changes: Clicking Refresh Models after changing your LiteLLM API key or base URL now immediately reloads the model list using the new credentials, so you do not need to clear caches or restart VS Code, while background refreshes still benefit from caching for speed (#9536)). Black Forest Labs image generation on Roo Code Cloud: Use the free bfl/flux-2-pro:free model on Roo Code Cloud for high-quality image generation without unexpected charges, powered by the images_api image generation method for compatible models (#9587). Black Forest Labs models on OpenRouter: Adds Black Forest Labs FLUX.2 Flex and FLUX.2 Pro image generation models via OpenRouter, giving you additional high-quality options when you prefer to use your OpenRouter account for image generation (#9589). Bedrock Anthropic Claude Opus 4.5 for global inference: Adds the Anthropic Claude Opus 4.5 Bedrock model to the global inference model list so it can be used automatically anywhere global inference is supported, with no extra setup (#9595). AWS Bedrock embeddings for code indexing: Adds support for using AWS Bedrock embeddings in code indexing so teams that standardize on Bedrock can reuse their existing infrastructure when indexing repos for Roo-based navigation and search (#9475). Anthropic Native Tool Calling: Anthropic models now support native tool calling for improved performance and more reliable tool use (#9644). Z.AI Native Tool Calling: Z.AI models (glm-4.5, glm-4.5-air, glm-4.5-x, glm-4.5-airx, glm-4.5-flash, glm-4.5v, glm-4.6, glm-4-32b-0414-128k) now support native tool calling (#9645). Moonshot Native Tool Calling: Moonshot models now support native tool calling with parallel tool calls support (#9646).

This release introduces Browser Use 2.0 for richer web automation, adds the Baseten provider, improves OpenAI-compatible behavior, and refines onboarding and native tool descriptions to make it easier for Roo to understand and use your tools effectively.

Browser Use now supports a more capable "2.0" experience (#8941): Richer browser interaction: Enables more advanced navigation and interaction patterns so Roo can better follow multi-step web workflows. More reliable automation: Improves stability for sequences of clicks, typing, and scrolling, reducing the chance of flaky browser runs. Better fit for complex sites: Makes it easier to work with modern web apps that require multiple steps or stateful interactions. 📚 Documentation: See Browser Use for details on how to enable and use browser workflows. Note: We have not yet updated these docs with images and a video of the new experience.

Provider-Oriented Welcome Screen: Added a provider-focused welcome screen so new users can more quickly choose and configure a working model setup (#9484). Pinned Roo Provider: Pinned the Roo provider to the top of the provider list so it is easier to discover and select (#9485). Clearer Native Tool Descriptions: Enhanced built-in tool descriptions with examples and clarifications so Roo can choose the right tools and use them more accurately (#9486).

Streaming Cancel Responsiveness: Fixed the cancel button so it responds immediately during streaming, making it easier to stop long or unwanted runs (thanks jwadow!) (#9448). apply_diff Performance Regression: Resolved a recent performance regression in apply_diff, restoring fast patch application on larger edits (#9474). Model Cache Refresh: Implemented cache refreshing to avoid using stale disk-cached models, ensuring configuration updates are picked up correctly (#9478). Tool Call Fallbacks: Added a fallback to always yield tool calls regardless of finish_reason, preventing cases where valid tool calls were dropped (#9476).

Baseten Provider: Added Baseten as a new AI provider, giving you another option for hosted models and deployments (thanks AlexKer!) (#9461). OpenAI-Compatible Improvements: Improved the base OpenAI-compatible provider configuration and error handling so more OpenAI-style endpoints work smoothly without special tweaks (#9462). OpenRouter Capabilities: Improved copying of model-level capabilities onto OpenRouter endpoint models so routing respects each model's real abilities (#9483).
此补丁版本允许在 Roo Code Cloud 模型上运行评估任务，使图像生成提示更清晰易读，优化了待办事项列表的更新逻辑，并防止重复的云同步消息。
单一待办事项列表更新：从聊天更新中移除了冗余的待办事项列表区块，确保在运行 updateTodoList 工具时仅显示一个简洁、集中的列表（#9517，#9522）。 云消息去重：修复了云消息同步问题，避免相同推理或助手消息的重复副本被重复同步，使任务历史记录更清晰、更易理解（#9518，#9522）。
更清晰的图像生成提示：图像生成的完整提示和路径现已直接显示在聊天界面中，采用更清晰的间距和排版，便于检查、调试和重用提示（#9505，#9522）。 在 Roo Code Cloud 上运行评估任务：现在可直接在 Roo Code Cloud 模型上运行评估任务，复用与常规云运行相同的托管模型和任务令牌（#9492，#9522）。

This patch release adds Claude Opus 4.5 support across OpenRouter, Anthropic, and Vertex, introduces Roo Code Cloud image generation, and improves provider reliability for Gemini, Cerebras, and LiteLLM-backed models.

Claude Opus 4.5 is now available through multiple providers with support for large context windows, prompt caching, and reasoning budgets (#9540, #9541): Roo Code Cloud: Run Claude Opus 4.5 as a managed cloud model for long, reasoning-heavy tasks without managing API keys yourself. OpenRouter: Use the anthropic/claude-opus-4.5 model with prompt caching and reasoning budget support so you can run longer or more complex tasks with lower latency and cost. Anthropic: Access claude-opus-4-5-20251101 directly via the Anthropic provider with full support for large context windows and reasoning budgets. Vertex AI: Use claude-opus-4-5@20251101 on Vertex AI for managed, region-aware deployments with reasoning budget support.

Roo Code Cloud image generation provider: Roo Code Cloud is now available as an image generation provider, so you can generate images directly through Roo Code Cloud instead of relying only on third-party image APIs (#9528)). Cerebras model list clean-up: The Cerebras provider model list now only shows currently supported models, reducing errors from deprecated Cerebras/Qwen variants and keeping the model picker aligned with what the API actually serves (#9527)). Reliable LiteLLM model refresh after credential changes: Clicking Refresh Models after changing your LiteLLM API key or base URL now immediately reloads the model list using the new credentials, so you do not need to clear caches or restart VS Code, while background refreshes still benefit from caching for speed (#9536)).

XML tool protocol stays in sync with configuration: Tool runs that use the XML protocol now correctly track the configured tool protocol after configuration updates, preventing rare parser-state errors when switching between XML and native tools (#9535)).

Gemini 3 reasoning_details support: Fixes 400 INVALID_ARGUMENT errors when using Gemini 3 models via OpenRouter by fully supporting the newer reasoning_details format, so multi-turn and tool-calling conversations now work reliably without dropping reasoning context (#9506)). Skip unsupported Gemini content blocks safely: Gemini conversations on Vertex AI now skip unsupported metadata blocks (such as certain reasoning or document types) with a warning instead of failing the entire thread, keeping long-running chats stable (#9537)).

This patch release adds free Black Forest Labs image generation models on Roo Code Cloud and OpenRouter, and makes native MCP tools more reliable by preserving tool names and tool_use blocks during context condensing.

New Black Forest Labs FLUX.2 models are now wired through Roo Code’s image pipeline for Roo Code Cloud image generation (#9587): Free image generation on Roo Code Cloud: Use the bfl/flux-2-pro:free model on Roo Code Cloud for high-quality image generation without worrying about unexpected image charges. Native images API support: The images_api image generation method is supported for compatible models, improving parity with provider-native image APIs and giving better forwards compatibility as providers add new features. 📚 Documentation: See Image Generation for how to use image generation in Roo Code.
documents.s: Black Forest Labs image generation on Roo Code Cloud

documents.t: Native MCP tool names preserved in history: Native mode now keeps the real dynamic MCP tool names (such as mcp_serverName_toolName) in the API history instead of teaching the model a fake use_mcp_tool name, so follow-up calls pick the right tools and tool suggestions stay consistent (#9559). Native tools condensing keeps tool_use context: When condensing long conversations that use native tools, required tool_use and tool_result blocks are preserved in the summary message, preventing 400 errors and avoiding lost context during follow-up turns (#9582).

Black Forest Labs models on OpenRouter: Adds Black Forest Labs FLUX.2 Flex and FLUX.2 Pro image generation models via OpenRouter, giving you additional high-quality options when you prefer to use your OpenRouter account for image generation (#9589).

此版本添加了 Roo Code Cloud 作为代码库索引的嵌入提供者，流式传输原生工具调用，扩展了 Claude Opus 4.5 支持，并包含了用户界面、可靠性和成本改进。 Roo Code Cloud 代码库索引嵌入功能：使用 Roo Code Cloud 作为托管嵌入提供者进行代码库索引，这样您就可以在不运行自己的嵌入服务或管理单独 API 密钥的情况下，为您的项目构建语义搜索。代码索引用户界面现在将 Roo Code Cloud 显示为嵌入器选项，并通过 Roo Code Cloud 批量处理、速率限制和认证嵌入请求，以实现更可靠的索引。(#9543) (#9542) 有关设置和使用详情，请参阅代码库索引和Roo Code Router。 流式传输原生工具调用：原生工具（包括 Roo Code Cloud 和 OpenRouter 助手）现在将参数和部分结果流式传输到用户界面，与 XML 工具的流式体验相匹配，这样您就可以观察长时间运行操作的进度并更轻松地调试工具行为。(#9542)
使用 mise 简化裸机评估设置：将裸机评估设置脚本标准化为使用 mise 运行时管理器而不是 asdf，减少设置摩擦并避免运行本地评估的贡献者出现版本不匹配问题。(#9548) “关于 Roo Code”页面中的联系链接：在“关于 Roo Code”设置页面直接添加清晰的联系选项，这样您就可以快速报告错误、请求功能、披露安全问题或通过电子邮件联系团队，而无需离开扩展程序。(#9570)

流式传输后续问题：修复 ask_followup_question 流式传输，使用户界面仅显示预期的问题文本而不是原始 JSON，并确保所有原生工具在启用流式传输时正确发出和处理部分工具调用，防止出现令人困惑或丢失的工具输出。(#9561) Claude Opus 4.5 的提示缓存：确保 Anthropic Claude Opus 4.5 请求现在像其他 Claude 模型一样使用提示缓存，显著降低依赖 Opus 4.5 的用户的持续 API 成本（感谢 iainRedro！）。(#9568)

Claude Code 中的 Claude Opus 4.5：将 claude-opus-4-5-20251101 模型添加到 Claude Code 提供者，这样您就可以像选择其他 Claude 代码模型一样选择它，支持提示缓存，不支持图像，并且在用户界面中没有推理努力/预算控制。(#9560) AWS Bedrock 中的 Claude Opus 4.5：通过 AWS Bedrock 提供者公开 Claude Opus 4.5，这样 Bedrock 用户就可以访问与现有 Claude Opus 4 模型相同的 20 万上下文、8192 令牌限制、提示缓存和推理功能（感谢 pisicode！）。(#9572) 有关启用和配置此模型的详情，请参阅AWS Bedrock。
This release improves native tool calling workflows, enhances the web-evals dashboard, and refines provider and embeddings behavior.

Experimental multiple native tool calls per turn with guardrails: Lets the native tool protocol run multiple tools in a single assistant turn and blocks attempt_completion() if any tool fails in that turn, reducing the risk of partial or incorrect completions (#9273). Web-evals dashboard enhancements with dynamic tool columns and UX improvements: Adds aggregate run statistics, per-tool success metrics, and dynamic tool usage columns so you can quickly spot failing tools or exercises and compare runs without rebuilding configs (#9592). Native tools as default for specific Roo Code Cloud models: Sets the providers’ native tool protocol as the default for minimax/minimax-m2 and anthropic/claude-haiku-4.5 on Roo Code Cloud to reduce configuration overhead and improve tool-calling reliability (#9586).

API handler refresh on tool protocol changes: Ensures switching API profiles that only change the tool protocol still refreshes the underlying handler and parser so tool calls always use the correct configuration (#9599). Native tools file reading regression for Grok Code Fast: Restricts the single-file read behavior to XML tools so native tool calls use the standard multi-file-aware file reader and can access the workspace as expected (#9600). Roo Code Cloud embeddings revert and reliability: Removes Roo Code Cloud as an embeddings provider to prevent codebase_search from appearing when it is not configured and to avoid indexing getting stuck in a standby state (#9602).

Bedrock Anthropic Claude Opus 4.5 for global inference: Adds the Anthropic Claude Opus 4.5 Bedrock model to the global inference model list so it can be used automatically anywhere global inference is supported, with no extra setup (#9595).
This release adds native tool calling support for Anthropic, Z.AI, and Moonshot providers, improves cloud onboarding, and fixes several bugs.
Improved Cloud Sign-in Experience: Adds a "taking you to cloud" screen with a progress indicator during authentication, plus a manual URL entry option as fallback for more reliable onboarding (#9652)

OpenRouter GPT-5 Schema Validation: Fixes schema validation errors when using GPT-5 models via OpenRouter with the read_file tool (#9633) write_to_file Directory Creation: Fixes ENOENT errors when creating files in non-existent subdirectories (thanks ivanenev!) (#9640) OpenRouter Tool Calls: Fixes tool calls handling when using OpenRouter provider (#9642) Claude Code Configuration: Fixes configuration conflicts by correctly disabling native tools and temperature support options that are managed by the Claude Code CLI (#9643)

Anthropic Native Tool Calling: Anthropic models now support native tool calling for improved performance and more reliable tool use (#9644) Z.AI Native Tool Calling: Z.AI models (glm-4.5, glm-4.5-air, glm-4.5-x, glm-4.5-airx, glm-4.5-flash, glm-4.5v, glm-4.6, glm-4-32b-0414-128k) now support native tool calling (#9645) Moonshot Native Tool Calling: Moonshot models now support native tool calling with parallel tool calls support (#9646)
This release adds AWS Bedrock embeddings support for code indexing, improves native tool and provider behavior, and fixes several reliability issues across Bedrock, Vertex, and native tooling.

AWS Bedrock embeddings for code indexing: Adds support for using AWS Bedrock embeddings in code indexing so teams that standardize on Bedrock can reuse their existing infrastructure when indexing repos for Roo-based navigation and search (PR #9475).

Native tool calling for Mistral: Adds native tool calling support for the Mistral provider, enabling more reliable tool workflows and better multi-step automation when using Mistral models (PR #9625). Parallel native tool execution via OpenAI protocol: Wires the MULTIPLE_NATIVE_TOOL_CALLS experiment to OpenAI's parallel_tool_calls capability so multiple tools can run in parallel under the OpenAI-compatible protocol, improving throughput for tool-heavy tasks (PR #9621). Fine-grained tool streaming for OpenRouter Anthropic: Adds fine-grained tool streaming support for Anthropic models on OpenRouter so tool call responses stream more smoothly and stay aligned with Anthropic's tool semantics (PR #9629). Global inference selection for Bedrock with cross-region: Allows global inference to pick Bedrock models correctly even when cross-region routing is enabled, reducing the risk of mismatched regions or unavailable models during automatic selection (PR #9616).

Vertex Anthropic content block filtering: Filters out non-Anthropic content blocks before sending requests to the Vertex Anthropic API so mixed or unsupported blocks no longer cause request failures (#9583, PR #9618). WriteToFileTool partial content safety: Restores a missing content undefined check in WriteToFileTool.handlePartial() to prevent rare crashes or incorrect writes when partial content is unavailable (#9611, PR #9614). Model cache avoids persisting empty responses: Prevents the model cache from persisting empty API responses so configuration and model metadata do not get silently replaced with blank entries (#9597, PR #9623). Skip access_mcp_resource when no resources exist: Excludes the access_mcp_resource tool from native tool runs when an MCP server does not expose any resources, avoiding confusing no-op calls and making tool menus cleaner (PR #9615). Inline terminal and indexing defaults: Updates default settings for the inline terminal and codebase indexing to better match common workflows out of the box, reducing the amount of manual tuning needed after installation (PR #9622). Native new_task tool_result timing: Defers emitting the new_task tool_result in the native protocol until the corresponding subtask actually finishes, eliminating premature “done” signals and keeping task state accurate for downstream tools (PR #9628).
This release fixes a race condition affecting subtask handling in native protocol APIs.

Race Condition in new_task Tool: Fixes a timing issue where subtasks completing quickly (within 500ms) could break conversation history when using the new_task tool with native protocol APIs. Users on native protocol providers should now experience more reliable subtask handling. (#9655)
This release introduces metadata-driven subtasks that never lose their parent connection, plus native tool calling support for 15+ providers.

The connection between subtasks and parent tasks no longer breaks when you exit a task, crash, reboot, or reload VS Code (#9090). Subtask relationships are now controlled by metadata, so the parent-child link persists through any interruption.

Native tool calling support has been expanded to 15+ providers: Bedrock (#9698) Cerebras (#9692) Chutes (#9715) DeepInfra (#9691) DeepSeek & Doubao (#9671) Groq (#9673) LiteLLM (#9719) Ollama (#9696) OpenAI-compatible: Fireworks, SambaNova, Featherless, IO Intelligence (#9676) Requesty (#9672) Unbound (#9699) Vercel AI Gateway (#9697) Vertex Gemini (#9678) xAI with new Grok 4 Fast models (#9690)

Improved Onboarding: Simplified provider settings during initial setup—advanced options remain in Settings (#9709) Cleaner Toolbar: Modes and MCP settings consolidated into the main settings panel for better discoverability (#9710) Tool Format in Environment Details: Models now receive tool format information, improving behavior when switching between XML and native tools (#9661) Debug Buttons: View API and UI history with new debug buttons (requires roo-cline.debug: true) (#9684) Grok Code Fast Default: Native tools now default for xai/grok-code-fast-1 (#9717) New Welcome View: Simplified welcome view with consolidated components for a cleaner, more consistent onboarding experience (#9741) Simplified write_to_file Tool: The line_count parameter has been removed from the write_to_file tool, making tool calls cleaner and reducing potential errors from incorrect line counts (#9667) OpenRouter Embeddings Provider Routing: Select specific routing providers for OpenRouter embeddings in code indexing settings, enabling cost optimization since providers can vary by 4-5x in price for the same embedding model (thanks SannidhyaSah!) (#9693) CloudView Interface Updates: Cleaner UI with refreshed marketing copy, updated button styling with rounded corners for a more modern look (#9776)

Parallel Tool Calls Fix: Preserve tool_use blocks in summary during context condensation, fixing 400 errors with Anthropic's parallel tool calls feature (thanks SilentFlower!) (#9714) Navigation Button Wrapping: Prevent navigation buttons from wrapping on smaller screens (#9721) Task Delegation Tool Flush: Fixes 400 errors that occurred when using native tool protocol with parallel tool calls (e.g., update_todo_list + new_task). Pending tool results are now properly flushed before task delegation (#9726) Malformed Tool Call Fix: Fixed a regression where malformed native tool calls would cause Roo Code to hang indefinitely. Tool calls now proceed to validation which catches and reports the missing parameters properly (#9758)

Model-specific Tool Customization: Configure excludedTools and includedTools per model for fine-grained tool availability control (#9641) apply_patch Tool: New native tool for file editing using simplified diff format with fuzzy matching and file rename support (#9663) search_and_replace Tool: Batch text replacements with partial matching and error recovery (#9549) Better IPC Error Logging: Error logs now display detailed structured data instead of unhelpful [object Object] messages, making debugging extension issues easier (#9727) Stealth Model Privacy: Models tagged with "stealth" in the Roo API now receive vendor confidentiality instructions in their system prompt, enabling white-label or anonymous model experiences (#9742)

Model Default Temperatures: Models can now specify their own default temperature settings. Temperature precedence is: user's custom setting → model's default → system default (#9734) Roo Provider Native Tools: Models with the default-native-tools tag automatically use native tool calling by default (#9735) LiteLLM Native Tool Support: All LiteLLM models now assume native tool support by default, improving tool compatibility (#9736) App Version Tracking: The Roo provider now sends app version information with API requests for improved request tracking (#9730) z.ai GLM Model Fix: Removed misleading reasoning toggle UI for GLM-4.5 and GLM-4.6 models on z.ai provider, as these models don't support think/reasoning data for coding agents (#9752) Roo Provider Tool Compatibility: Improved tool conversion for OpenAI-compatible API endpoints, ensuring tools work correctly with OpenAI-style request formats (#9769) MiniMax M2 Free Tier Default: MiniMax M2 model now defaults to the free tier when using OpenRouter (#9778)
This release introduces metadata-driven subtasks that never lose their parent connection, plus native tool calling support for 15+ providers.

The connection between subtasks and parent tasks no longer breaks when you exit a task, crash, reboot, or reload VS Code (#9090). Subtask relationships are now controlled by metadata, so the parent-child link persists through any interruption.

Native tool calling support has been expanded to 15+ providers: Bedrock (#9698) Cerebras (#9692) Chutes (#9715) DeepInfra (#9691) DeepSeek & Doubao (#9671) Groq (#9673) LiteLLM (#9719) Ollama (#9696) OpenAI-compatible: Fireworks, SambaNova, Featherless, IO Intelligence (#9676) Requesty (#9672) Unbound (#9699) Vercel AI Gateway (#9697) Vertex Gemini (#9678) xAI with new Grok 4 Fast models (#9690)

Improved Onboarding: Simplified provider settings during initial setup—advanced options remain in Settings (#9709) Cleaner Toolbar: Modes and MCP settings consolidated into the main settings panel for better discoverability (#9710) Tool Format in Environment Details: Models now receive tool format information, improving behavior when switching between XML and native tools (#9661) Debug Buttons: View API and UI history with new debug buttons (requires roo-cline.debug: true) (#9684) Grok Code Fast Default: Native tools now default for xai/grok-code-fast-1 (#9717)

Parallel Tool Calls Fix: Preserve tool_use blocks in summary during context condensation, fixing 400 errors with Anthropic's parallel tool calls feature (thanks SilentFlower!) (#9714) Navigation Button Wrapping: Prevent navigation buttons from wrapping on smaller screens (#9721)

Model-specific Tool Customization: Configure excludedTools and includedTools per model for fine-grained tool availability control (#9641) apply_patch Tool: New native tool for file editing using simplified diff format with fuzzy matching and file rename support (#9663) search_and_replace Tool: Batch text replacements with partial matching and error recovery (#9549)
This release improves provider behavior with model default temperatures and enhanced native tool support across providers.

Model Default Temperatures: Models can now specify their own default temperature settings. Temperature precedence is: user's custom setting → model's default → system default (#9734) Roo Provider Native Tools: Models with the default-native-tools tag automatically use native tool calling by default for improved tool-based interactions (#9735) LiteLLM Native Tool Support: All LiteLLM models now assume native tool support by default, improving tool compatibility and reducing configuration issues (#9736) App Version Tracking: The Roo provider now sends app version information with API requests for improved request tracking and analytics (#9730)
此补丁版本修复了任务委派期间并行工具调用的问题，并改进了错误诊断。
documents.s: Roo Code v3.35.1 版本说明 (2025-12-01)

documents.t: 并行工具调用修复：修复了在使用原生工具协议进行并行工具调用（例如 update_todo_list + new_task）时出现的 400 错误。现在任务委派前会正确刷新待处理的工具结果 (#9726)
更好的 IPC 错误日志记录：错误日志现在显示详细的结构化数据，而不是无用的 [object Object] 消息，使扩展问题调试更加容易 (#9727)
此版本修复了工具调用处理回归问题，简化了 write_to_file 工具，并更正了 z.ai 提供商的用户界面。
documents.s: Roo Code 3.35.4 版本发布说明 (2025-12-02)

documents.t: 简化的 write_to_file 工具：从 write_to_file 工具中移除了 line_count 参数，使工具调用更简洁，并减少了因行数统计错误导致的潜在问题 (#9667)
格式错误工具调用修复：修复了格式错误的原生工具调用导致 Roo Code 无限期挂起的回归问题。现在工具调用会进入验证流程，正确捕获并报告缺失参数 (#9758)
z.ai GLM 模型修复：移除了 z.ai 提供商中 GLM-4.5 和 GLM-4.6 模型具有误导性的推理切换界面，因为这些模型不支持编码代理的 think/reasoning 数据 (#9752)
本次发布通过简化欢迎界面提升了用户上手体验，并为 API 提供方新增了对隐身模型的支持。
全新欢迎界面：采用整合组件的简化欢迎界面，提供更简洁、一致的上手体验（#9741）
隐身模型隐私：在 Roo API 中标记为 "stealth" 的模型，其系统提示词中将包含供应商保密指令，从而支持白标或匿名模型体验（#9742）
此版本为 OpenRouter 嵌入模型添加了提供商路由选择功能，更新了 CloudView 界面，并提升了提供商兼容性。
documents.s: Roo Code v3.35.5 版本说明 (2025-12-03)

documents.t: OpenRouter 嵌入模型提供商路由：在代码索引设置中选择特定的 OpenRouter 嵌入模型路由提供商，由于相同嵌入模型的价格可能因提供商而异（价格差异可达 4-5 倍），因此可实现成本优化（感谢 SannidhyaSah！）（#9693）
CloudView 界面更新：更简洁的 UI，采用全新的营销文案，按钮样式更新为圆角设计，呈现更现代的视觉效果（#9776）
Roo Provider 工具兼容性：改进了与 OpenAI 兼容 API 端点的工具转换，确保工具能够正确处理 OpenAI 风格的请求格式（#9769） MiniMax M2 免费层级默认设置：使用 OpenRouter 时，MiniMax M2 模型现在默认使用免费层级（#9778）

This release introduces non-destructive context management for reliable checkpoint restoration, adds reasoning visibility for supported models, and improves provider reliability across Roo, Minimax, Cerebras, and Vercel AI Gateway.

Context condensing and sliding window truncation now preserve your original messages internally rather than deleting them (#9665). When you rewind to an earlier checkpoint, the full conversation history is restored automatically. This applies to both automatic condensing and sliding window operations.

Reasoning Details Support: The Roo provider now displays reasoning details from models with extended thinking capabilities, giving you visibility into how the model approaches your requests (#9796) Native Tools Default: All Roo provider models now default to native tool protocol for improved reliability and performance (#9811) Minimax search_and_replace: The Minimax M2 model now uses search_and_replace for more reliable file editing operations (#9780) Cerebras Token Optimization: Conservative 8K token limits prevent premature rate limiting (thanks sebastiand-cerebras!), plus deprecated model cleanup (#9804) Vercel AI Gateway: More reliable model fetching for models without complete pricing information (#9791)

Write Tool Validation: Resolved false positives where write_to_file incorrectly rejected complete markdown files containing inline code comments like # NEW: or // Step 1: (thanks Michaelzag!) (#9787) Download Count Display: Fixed homepage download count to display with proper precision for million-scale numbers (#9807)

Tool Consolidation: Removed the deprecated insert_content tool; use apply_diff or write_to_file for file modifications (#9751) Experimental Settings: Temporarily disabled the parallel tool calls experiment while improvements are in progress (#9798) Infrastructure: Updated Next.js dependencies for web applications (#9799)
Roo Code 3.36 引入了非破坏性上下文管理、新的调试和 UI 控件，以及持续的可靠性修复和提供商改进。
documents.s: Roo Code 3.36 版本说明（综合）

documents.t: 上下文压缩和滑动窗口截断现在会在内部保留原始消息，而不是删除它们 (#9665)。当您回退到较早的检查点时，完整的对话历史记录会自动恢复。
Roo Code 支持 GPT-5.1 Codex Max，OpenAI 的长期编码模型，包括 gpt-5.1 / gpt-5 / gpt-5-mini 变体的模型默认值 (#9848)。
浏览器工具现在可以通过新的 screenshot 操作将截图保存到指定文件路径，以便在浏览器自动化任务期间捕获视觉状态 (#9963)。
如果您将 gpt-5.1-codex-max 与 OpenAI 提供商一起使用，现在可以选择“超高”推理强度级别，以在复杂任务上获得最大推理深度 (#9900)。
支持原生工具的 OpenRouter 模型现在默认使用原生工具调用，无需手动配置即可提高工具调用的可靠性 (#9878)。
悬停在错误行上可显示一个信息图标，点击后会打开一个包含完整错误详情和复制按钮的模态框 (#9985)。
GPT-5.2 在 OpenAI 提供商中可用，并设置为默认模型 (#10024)。
您现在可以配置聊天输入中 Enter 键的行为，使其更好地适应多行提示和不同的输入方法 (#10002)。
gemini-3-flash-preview 模型现在在 Roo Code Cloud 提供商、Google Gemini、GCP Vertex AI、Requesty 和 OpenRouter 提供商中可用。这是 Google 发布的最新模型（感谢贡献者！）（#10151）。
DeepSeek 提供商的 deepseek-reasoner 模型现在支持“交错思考”和原生工具调用。在我们的内部评估中，工具调用成功率为 100%，扩展运行得分提高到 93.4%（感谢 zbww_！）（#9969，#10141）。
documents.s: DeepSeek reasoner：工具使用期间的交错思考

documents.t: 支持原生工具调用的模型现在默认使用原生协议而不是 XML。XML 协议仍在提供商设置中可用 (#10186)。
当您在 Vertex AI 上使用 Claude Sonnet 4.5 时，可以为支持的模型启用 1M 上下文窗口 选项 (#10209)。
documents.s: Vertex AI：Claude Sonnet 4.5 的 1M 上下文窗口

documents.t: 聊天错误状态现在更容易理解出错原因，并在提交错误报告时更容易分享正确的详细信息： 更清晰的错误可见性：错误行通过更明显的 查看详情 操作更一致地显示完整错误详情（包括状态代码） (#10204) 可下载的诊断信息：您可以从聊天错误生成本地诊断文件（包括错误元数据和 API 对话历史记录），以便审查/编辑并与问题报告共享 (#10188)
documents.s: 聊天错误故障排除改进

documents.t: 斜杠命令的符号链接支持：使用单个文件或目录的符号链接在项目之间共享和组织命令，命令名称派生自符号链接名称 (#9838) 更流畅的聊天滚动：聊天视图在流式传输期间更可靠地保持滚动位置 (#8999) 更清晰的错误消息：更具操作性的错误，并直接链接到文档 (#9777) Enter 键行为切换：配置 Enter 键是在聊天输入中发送消息还是插入换行符 (#10002) 统一的上下文管理用户体验：截断通知和压缩摘要的实时反馈 (#9795) 更好的 OpenAI 错误消息：从 API 错误中提取更多详细信息，以便更轻松地进行故障排除 (#9639) Token 计数优化：移除用于 token 计数的单独 API 调用以提高性能 (#9884) 工具说明与系统提示解耦：特定工具的指导包含在工具描述中 (#9784) 后续建议中更清晰的自动批准时间：使自动批准倒计时更不容易错过 (#10048) 简化的自动批准设置：移除重试和待办事项更新的单独切换，减少配置开销 (#10062) 更丰富的错误详情对话框：在错误详情对话框中添加额外上下文（扩展版本、提供商/模型、时间戳等），以便更快地进行调试和报告问题 (#10050) 减少大文件的 read_file 失败：通过增量读取直到 token 预算并在需要时返回更清晰的截断来改进大文件读取 (#10052) 使用 Gemini 模型改进文件编辑：新的 edit_file 工具使 Gemini 模型在编辑文件时更有效 (#9983) VS Code LM 原生工具：原生工具调用现在适用于 VS Code 内置的 Copilot 模型 (#10191) Gemini 和 OpenAI 更智能的工具默认值：Gemini 和 OpenAI 模型现在使用更好的默认工具进行文件编辑，开箱即用地提高可靠性。 (#10170) 工具错误的宽限期重试：当模型无法使用工具时，Roo Code 现在会在显示错误之前静默重试。只有在连续失败后才会出现更清晰的“模型响应不完整”消息 (#10196)

编写工具验证：避免 write_to_file 对包含内联代码注释（如 # NEW: 或 // Step 1:）的完整 Markdown 文件产生误报 (#9787) 上下文截断令牌显示：修复上下文截断 UI 中可能显示错误的截断前后令牌总数的问题，尤其是在工具调用频繁的对话中 (#9961) 下载计数显示：修复主页下载计数在百万级数字下的精度问题 (#9807) 扩展冻结预防：防止模型尝试调用不存在的工具时导致扩展冻结 (#9834) 检查点恢复可靠性：重做操作期间消息历史记录处理保持一致 (#9842) 上下文截断修复：通过仅截断可见消息防止级联截断循环 (#9844) 推理模型：需要推理的模型始终接收有效的推理努力值 (#9836) 终端输入处理：内联终端在命令需要用户输入时不再挂起 (#9827) 大文件安全性：大文件读取更安全地处理令牌预算 (#9843) 后续按钮样式：修复后续建议按钮过度圆角的问题 (#9829) Chutes 提供商修复：通过使可选字段的架构验证更健壮来解决模型获取错误 (#9854) 工具协议选择器：始终为 OpenAI 兼容提供商显示工具协议选择器 (#9966) apply_diff 过滤：在禁用 diff 时正确将 apply_diff 从原生工具中排除 (#9920) API 超时处理：修复被禁用的超时（设置为 0）导致请求立即失败的问题 (#9960) 推理努力下拉菜单：遵守显式的 supportsReasoningEffort 值并修复禁用处理 (#9970, #9930) 重试时显示实际错误消息：显示提供商的错误详情而非通用文本 (#9954) 流挂起修复：确保 finish_reason 为多个提供商触发 tool_call_end 事件 (#9927, #9929) tool_result ID 验证：在请求前验证并修复 tool_result ID 以防止提供商拒绝 (#9952) 抑制的内部错误：修复内部“ask promise was ignored”错误泄漏到对话中的问题 (#9914) 提供商清理：修复使用已删除/无效 API 提供商时的无限循环问题 (#9869) 上下文图标主题：上下文管理图标现在使用前景色以匹配 VS Code 主题 (#9912) 评估运行删除：修复阻止评估运行删除的外键约束 (#9909) OpenAI 兼容超时可靠性：添加超时处理以防止无限期挂起 (#9898) MCP 工具流式传输：修复 MCP 工具因过早清除内部流式数据而出现“未知工具”错误的问题 (#9993) TODO 列表显示顺序：TODO 项按执行顺序显示，而非按状态分组 (#9991) 遥测改进：从 API 错误遥测中过滤掉 429 速率限制错误以获得更清晰的指标 (#9987) Gemini 稳定性：修复推理循环和空响应错误 (#10007) 并行工具执行：修复并行工具使用期间“Expected toolResult blocks at messages”错误 (#10015) tool_result ID 不匹配：修复历史记录中存在孤立 tool_result 块时的 ToolResultIdMismatchError (#10027) 并行工具调用修复：在上下文压缩期间保留 tool_use 块以避免并行工具调用时的 API 错误 (#9714) 导航按钮换行：防止导航按钮在小屏幕上换行 (#9721) 任务委派工具刷新：在将任务委派给其他代理之前确保刷新待处理的工具结果，以避免提供商 400 错误 (#9726) 畸形工具调用处理：通过验证并报告缺失参数，防止扩展在畸形工具调用时无限期挂起 (#9758) 开始输入时自动批准停止：修复在您开始编写响应后自动批准计时器仍可能触发的问题 (#9937) 更实用的 OpenRouter 错误消息：在可用时显示上游错误详情 (#10039) LiteLLM 工具协议下拉菜单始终显示：即使模型元数据尚不可用，也会在高级设置中恢复工具协议下拉菜单 (#10053) MCP 工具调用适用于更严格的提供商：通过清理名称并使用明确的 mcp--server--tool ID 格式，避免 MCP 服务器/工具名称中的特殊字符导致的失败 (#10054) 模式工具验证更一致：通过在一个位置整合模式工具可用性检查来提高可靠性 (#10089) 跨提供商工具调用 ID 兼容性：修复通过 OpenRouter 路由到对工具调用 ID 要求更严格的提供商/模型时工具调用可能失败的问题 (#10102) MCP 嵌套架构兼容性：通过确保嵌套工具架构设置 additionalProperties: false，修复 MCP 工具在更严格的架构验证下可能失败的问题 (#10109) 更可靠的委派恢复：修复委派后恢复父任务时因工具结果 ID 不匹配而失败的问题 (#10135) VS Code LM 工具架构兼容性：通过将工具输入架构标准化为 Copilot 期望的格式，修复使用 VS Code LM 提供商（GitHub Copilot）时 Roo 尝试原生工具调用可能导致 HTTP 400 错误的问题 (#10221) 避免删除错误的 API 消息：修复删除用户消息时可能删除早期助手 API 消息的竞争条件，尤其是在流式传输/工具使用期间 (#10113) 跨配置去重 MCP 工具：修复当同一 MCP 服务器同时存在于全局配置和项目配置时出现的“工具已定义”错误 (#10096) 修复供应商定价页面链接：修复损坏的路由，使供应商定价链接跳转到正确的目标页面 (#10107) MCP 工具 Schema 标准化：通过标准化 JSON Schema 格式，修复在严格模式下使用 Amazon Bedrock 或 OpenAI 时 MCP 工具 schema 可能无法通过验证的问题 (#10148) Bedrock 中带点的 MCP 工具名称：修复在 Amazon Bedrock 中使用名称包含点或冒号的 MCP 服务器（如 awslabs.aws-documentation-mcp-server）时的验证错误 (#10152) Bedrock 任务恢复：修复在禁用原生工具时恢复 Amazon Bedrock 任务时出现的错误，用户此前会遇到 The toolConfig field must be defined 错误 (#10155) Roo Code Cloud 模型刷新：修复登录 Roo Code Cloud 后，需要身份验证的模型（如 google/gemini-3-flash）无法立即显示的问题 (#10156) LiteLLM 工具协议下拉菜单：原生/XML 协议选择器现在可正确显示于 LiteLLM 模型 (#10187) 任务恢复：更改原生工具调用设置后恢复任务时不再中断 (#10192) Bedrock 嵌入器 CloudTrail 修复：使用代码库索引时，AWS Bedrock 用户现在可在 CloudTrail 日志中看到 Roo Code 的标识（感谢 jackrein！）（#10166） MCP 与 OpenAI 供应商的兼容性：修复在工具 schema 中使用 format: "uri" 的 MCP 服务器无法与 OpenAI 供应商配合使用的问题 (#10198) 为 LM Studio 和 Qwen-Code 启用原生工具调用支持：修复这些供应商缺少 OpenAI 风格原生工具调用支持的问题，此前可能导致工具使用相较于其他供应商不可靠 (#10208) 为 OpenAI 兼容供应商提供更可靠的工具默认值：通过应用原生工具默认值（除非用户明确覆盖），修复除非手动调整自定义模型信息否则工具调用可能不一致的情况 (#10213) 启用 Requesty 原生工具调用：修复 Requesty 供应商的原生工具调用默认值（并统一 Unbound 的行为），使工具使用更加一致，尤其是在模型元数据被缓存时 (#10211) MCP 工具 schema 支持更严格的验证：修复部分 MCP 工具 schema 因对象 schema 缺少 additionalProperties: false 而无法通过严格验证的问题 (#10210) 刷新模型缓存可靠性：修复刷新模型可能无法完全清除/刷新部分供应商缓存模型列表的问题，并改进启动新任务时初始模型选择的准确性 (#9870)

评估 UI 增强：添加更好的筛选功能、批量删除操作、工具列整合以及运行备注 (#9837) 框架更新：将 Next.js 升级至 ~15.2.8，以提升与上游修复的兼容性 (#10140) 多模型评估启动：跨多个模型启动相同测试运行，并自动错开执行 (#9845) 新定价页面：更新网站定价页面，提供更清晰的功能说明 (#9821) 公告 UI 更新：通过更新的社交图标和 GitHub stars 行动号召，改进公告视觉效果 (#9945) 改进的错误日志记录：为 parseToolCall 异常和云作业错误添加更好的上下文信息 (#9857、#9924) search_replace 原生工具：添加用于单替换文件操作的工具，通过唯一文本匹配实现精确定位 (#9918) 版本化设置支持：为模型设置的 API 端版本控制添加内部基础设施，并设置最低插件版本门槛 (#9934) OpenRouter 遥测：添加 API 错误遥测以改进诊断 (#9953) 评估流式统计：工具使用统计实时流式传输，并对 token 使用进行限流 (#9926) 工具整合：移除已弃用的 insert_content 工具（请使用 apply_diff 或 write_to_file） (#9751) 实验性设置：暂时禁用并行工具调用实验，以待改进完成 (#9798) 基础设施：更新 Web 应用程序的 Next.js 依赖项 (#9799) 移除已弃用工具：移除已弃用的 list_code_definition_names 工具 (#10005) 模型特定工具命名的工具别名：添加对替代工具名称的支持，使不同模型可使用其期望的命名调用同一工具 (#9989) 组织的工作区任务可见性控制：添加组织级设置，控制 Roo Code Cloud “扩展任务” 在工作区中的可见程度 (#10020) 改进的 Web 评估运行日志：通过改进运行日志和格式化，使评估运行更易于检查 (#10081) 控制公共任务共享：添加组织级设置以禁用公共任务共享链接 (#10105) 评估 UI：更清晰的工具分组 + 持续时间修复：通过分组相关工具并修复运行持续时间可能缺失或不正确的情况，改进评估 UI (#10133) 错误监控：改进连续错误追踪 (#10193) 更好的错误分组：改进错误追踪以加快问题解决速度 (#10163)

推理详情支持（Roo provider）：显示来自受支持模型的推理详情 (#9796) 原生工具默认（Roo provider）：Roo provider 模型默认使用原生工具协议 (#9811) MiniMax search_and_replace：MiniMax M2 使用 search_and_replace 实现更可靠文件编辑 (#9780) Cerebras token 优化：防止过早触发速率限制并清理已弃用模型 (#9804) Vercel AI Gateway：在定价数据不完整时提供更可靠的模型获取 (#9791) 动态模型设置（Roo provider）：Roo 模型从 API 动态接收配置 (#9852) 优化的 GPT-5 工具配置：GPT-5.x、GPT-5.1.x 和 GPT-4.1 仅使用 apply_patch 进行文件编辑 (#9853) DeepSeek V3.2：更新至 V3.2，价格下调，默认使用原生工具，最大输出 8K (#9962) xAI 模型目录：修正上下文窗口，为 grok-3/grok-3-mini 添加图像支持，并移除已弃用模型 (#9872) xAI 工具偏好：配置 xAI 模型使用 search_replace 以获得更好的文件编辑兼容性 (#9923) DeepSeek V3.2 for Baseten：添加 DeepSeek V3.2 模型支持 (#9861) Baseten 模型调整：改进 maxTokens 限制和原生工具支持以提升稳定性 (#9866) Bedrock 模型：添加 Kimi、MiniMax 和 Qwen 模型配置 (#9905) Z.ai 端点选项：为使用 API 计费而非 Coding 计划的用户添加端点选项 (#9894) 更详细的 OpenRouter 错误报告：捕获更多 provider 特定的错误元数据，便于诊断故障 (#10073) OpenRouter 对 OpenAI 模型的工具支持：通过显式启用 apply_patch 并避免使用不支持的文件写入工具，使工具使用更可预测 (#10082) AWS Bedrock 服务层级支持：为受支持模型添加 Bedrock 服务层级选项（标准/灵活/优先） (#9955) Amazon Nova 2 Lite in Bedrock：将 Nova 2 Lite 模型添加至 Bedrock provider 模型列表 (#9830) 原生工具默认（更多 providers）：更多 providers 默认使用原生工具协议，以在 providers 之间实现更一致的工具调用 (#10059, #10021) Bedrock 自定义 ARN 限制更少：移除过于严格的 ARN 验证，避免阻止有效的 AWS Bedrock 自定义 ARN，同时保留非阻塞的区域不匹配警告 (#10110) 更简洁的 Bedrock 服务层级 UI：移除 Bedrock 服务层级选择器下方的额外描述文本，使 UI 更易于浏览 (#10118) Claude Code Provider 原生工具调用：Claude Code provider 现在支持原生工具调用，实现与 Claude 更直接高效的通信 (#10077) Z.ai 原生工具调用：Z.ai 模型（GLM-4.5 系列、GLM-4.6 等）现在默认使用原生工具调用 (#10158) OpenAI 兼容原生工具：OpenAI 兼容 providers 现在默认使用原生工具调用 (#10159) AWS GovCloud 和中国区域支持：AWS GovCloud 和中国区域的用户现在可以使用 Bedrock provider 的自定义 ARN（感谢 wisestmumbler！） (#10157) Vertex AI 上的 Claude 原生工具调用：Vertex AI 上的所有 Claude 模型现在默认使用原生工具调用，与直接访问 Anthropic API 的行为保持一致 (#10197)
此版本为更多提供商添加了 Gemini 3 Flash 预览模型，改进了 DeepSeek 推理模型在工具使用期间的“思考”行为，并修复了上下文 token 计数显示问题。
gemini-3-flash-preview 模型现已在 Roo Code Cloud 提供商、Google Gemini、GCP Vertex AI、Requesty 和 OpenRouter 提供商中可用。这是 Google 今天早上发布的最新模型（感谢贡献者们！）(#10151)。
DeepSeek 提供商的 deepseek-reasoner 模型现在支持“交错思考”和原生工具调用。在我们的内部评估中，工具调用成功率达到 100%，扩展运行得分提升至 93.4%（感谢 zbww_！）(#9969, #10141)。
documents.s: DeepSeek 推理模型：工具使用期间交错思考
documents.h: #deepseek-推理模型工具使用期间交错思考

documents.t: 上下文截断 token 显示：修复了上下文截断 UI 可能显示错误的截断前后 token 总数的问题，尤其是在工具调用频繁的对话中 (#9961)
框架更新：将 Next.js 更新至 ~15.2.8，以提高与上游修复的兼容性 (#10140)
此版本为更多提供商默认启用了原生工具调用，并修复了 Bedrock 和 MCP 工具的多个兼容性问题。
documents.s: Roo Code 3.36.11 版本发布说明 (2025-12-17)

documents.t: 现在，原生工具调用默认对三个额外的提供商启用：Claude Code、Z.ai 模型（GLM-4.5 系列、GLM-4.6 等）和 OpenAI 兼容提供商。这为这些模型提供了更直接、更高效的通信方式，提高了使用工具时的可靠性和性能 (#10077、#10158、#10159)。

MCP 工具 Schema 规范化：通过规范化 JSON Schema 格式，修复了 MCP 工具 Schema 在与 Amazon Bedrock 或 OpenAI 严格模式一起使用时可能无法通过验证的问题 (#10148) Bedrock 中使用带有点号或冒号的 MCP 工具名称：修复了在与 Amazon Bedrock 一起使用名称中包含点号或冒号的 MCP 服务器（如 awslabs.aws-documentation-mcp-server）时的验证错误 (#10152) Bedrock 任务恢复：修复了在使用 Amazon Bedrock 且禁用原生工具时恢复任务时的错误，用户会遇到 The toolConfig field must be defined 错误 (#10155) Roo Code Cloud 模型刷新：修复了登录 Roo Code Cloud 后，需要身份验证的模型（如 google/gemini-3-flash）不会立即出现的问题 (#10156) AWS GovCloud 和中国区域支持：修复了 AWS GovCloud 和中国区域的用户无法将自定义 ARN 与 Bedrock 提供商一起使用的问题（感谢 wisestmumbler！） (#10157)
This release adds GPT-5.1 Codex Max support, enables symlinks for slash commands, improves message management with better checkpoint restore, and fixes several stability issues.

Roo Code now supports GPT-5.1 Codex Max (#9848), OpenAI's most intelligent coding model optimized for long-horizon, agentic coding tasks. This release also adds model defaults for gpt-5.1, gpt-5, and gpt-5-mini variants with optimized configurations. 📚 Documentation: See OpenAI Provider for configuration details.

Symlink support for slash commands: Share and organize commands across projects using symlinks for individual files or directories, with command names derived from symlink names for easy aliasing (#9838) Smoother chat scroll: Chat view maintains scroll position more reliably during streaming, eliminating disruptive jumps (#8999) Improved error messages: Clearer, more actionable error messages with proper attribution and direct links to documentation (#9777)

Extension freeze prevention: The extension no longer freezes when a model attempts to call a non-existent tool (thanks daniel-lxs!) (#9834) Checkpoint restore reliability: MessageManager layer ensures consistent message history handling across all rewind operations (#9842) Context truncation fix: Prevent cascading truncation loops by only truncating visible messages (#9844) Reasoning models: Models that require reasoning now always receive valid reasoning effort values (#9836) Terminal input handling: Inline terminal no longer hangs when commands require user input (#9827) Large file safety: Safer large file reads with proper token budget accounting for model output (#9843) Follow-up button styling: Fixed overly rounded corners on follow-up question suggestions (#9829)

Evals UI enhancements: Added filtering by timeframe/model/provider, bulk delete actions, tool column consolidation, and run notes (#9837) Multi-model evals launch: Launch identical test runs across multiple models with automatic staggering (#9845) New pricing page: Updated website pricing page with clearer feature explanations (#9821)
此版本改进了 Gemini 和 OpenAI 模型的默认工具偏好设置，修复了 Bedrock 嵌入器识别问题，并增强了错误跟踪。
为 Gemini 和 OpenAI 智能化工具默认设置: Gemini 和 OpenAI 模型现在对文件编辑使用更好的默认工具，提高了开箱即用的可靠性。(#10170)
Bedrock 嵌入器 CloudTrail 修复: AWS Bedrock 用户在使用代码库索引时现在可以在 CloudTrail 日志中看到 Roo Code 的标识。(感谢 jackrein!) (#10166)
更好的错误分组: 改进了错误跟踪以加快问题解决速度。(#10163)
此版本默认切换为原生工具协议，改进了 Gemini 模型的文件编辑功能，并增加了对 VS Code 语言模型提供者的原生工具支持。
支持原生工具调用的模型现在默认使用原生协议，而不是 XML。XML 协议仍可在提供者设置中使用 (#10186)。
documents.s: 原生工具协议默认启用

documents.t: 改进 Gemini 模型的文件编辑功能：新的 edit_file 工具使 Gemini 模型在编辑文件时更加高效 (#9983) VS Code LM 原生工具：原生工具调用现在可与 VS Code 内置的 Copilot 模型配合使用 (#10191)
LiteLLM 工具协议下拉菜单：原生/XML 协议选择器现在可正确显示在 LiteLLM 模型中 (#10187) 任务恢复：更改原生工具调用设置后恢复任务时不再中断 (#10192)
错误监控：改进了对连续错误跟踪的处理 (#10193)
此版本为 Vertex AI 上的 Claude Sonnet 4.5 添加了 1M 上下文窗口选项，改进了聊天错误排查功能，并扩展了对原生工具调用的支持。
当您使用 Vertex AI 上的 Claude Sonnet 4.5 时，现在可以为支持的模型启用 1M 上下文窗口 选项 (#10209)。
documents.s: Vertex AI：为 Claude Sonnet 4.5 提供 1M 上下文窗口

documents.t: 聊天错误状态现在更容易理解问题所在，并且在提交错误报告时更容易分享正确的详细信息： 更清晰的错误可见性：错误行现在通过更明显的 查看详情 功能更一致地显示完整的错误详细信息（包括状态码） (#10204) 可下载的诊断信息：您可以从聊天错误生成一个本地诊断文件（包括错误元数据和 API 对话历史），以便您可以查看/编辑并将其与问题报告共享 (#10188)

为 LM Studio 和 Qwen-Code 提供原生工具调用支持：修复了这些提供商缺少 OpenAI 风格原生工具调用支持的问题，这可能导致工具使用相比其他提供商不可靠 (#10208) 为 OpenAI 兼容提供商提供更可靠的工具默认值：通过应用原生工具默认值（除非您明确覆盖它们），修复了除非您手动调整自定义模型信息否则工具调用可能不一致的情况 (#10213) 启用 Requesty 原生工具调用：修复了 Requesty 提供商的原生工具调用默认值（并统一了 Unbound 的行为），使工具使用更加一致，尤其是在模型元数据被缓存时 (#10211) 严格的 JSON Schema 兼容性：修复了某些 MCP 工具模式由于对象模式上缺少 additionalProperties: false 而无法通过严格验证的问题 (#10210) 刷新模型缓存可靠性：修复了 刷新模型 可能无法完全刷新某些提供商的缓存模型列表的问题，并改进了开始新任务时初始模型选择的正确性 (#9870)
此版本为 Vertex AI 上的 Claude 模型添加了原生工具调用功能，通过优雅重试机制改进了错误处理，并修复了与 OpenAI 提供商的 MCP 兼容性问题。
Vertex AI 上的 Claude 原生工具调用：Vertex AI 上的所有 Claude 模型现在默认使用原生工具调用，与直接使用 Anthropic API 的行为保持一致 (#10197)
工具错误的优雅重试：当模型无法使用工具时，Roo Code 现在会先静默重试，然后再显示错误。只有在连续失败后才显示更清晰的“模型响应不完整”消息 (#10196)
OpenAI 提供商的 MCP 兼容性：修复了 MCP 服务器在其工具模式中使用 format: "uri" 时与 OpenAI 提供商不兼容的问题 (#10198)
此版本修复了一个 VS Code LM provider 问题，该问题在使用原生工具调用时可能出现 HTTP 400 错误。
修复了使用 VS Code LM provider (GitHub Copilot) 时可能出现 HTTP 400 错误的问题，该错误发生在 Roo 尝试原生工具调用时，通过将工具输入 schema 标准化为 Copilot 期望的格式来解决 (#10221)
This release adds dynamic API settings support for Roo models, optimizes GPT-5 model configurations, and fixes Chutes provider model fetching.

Dynamic model settings: Roo models now receive configuration dynamically from the API, enabling faster iteration on model-specific settings without extension updates (#9852) Optimized GPT-5 tool configuration: GPT-5.x, GPT-5.1.x, and GPT-4.1 models now use only the apply_patch tool for file editing, improving code editing performance (#9853)
Chutes provider fix: Resolved model fetching errors for the Chutes provider by making schema validation more robust for optional fields (#9854)
This release adds an on-demand error details modal for improved debugging and fixes issues with MCP tool streaming, TODO list display order, and telemetry error filtering.
Hover over error rows to reveal an info icon that opens a modal with full error details and a copy button (#9985).

MCP Tool Streaming: Fixes an issue where MCP tools failed with "unknown tool" errors due to premature clearing of internal streaming data (#9993) TODO List Display Order: The TODO list in the chat view now displays items in their correct execution order instead of being grouped by status (#9991) Telemetry Improvements: Filters out 429 rate limit errors from API error telemetry for cleaner metrics and better error tracking (#9987)
This release adds browser screenshot saving, xhigh reasoning effort support, native tools default for OpenRouter, plus provider updates and bug fixes.
The browser tool now supports saving screenshots to a specified file path with a new screenshot action, enabling you to capture visual state during browser automation tasks. (#9963)

Users of the gpt-5.1-codex-max model with the OpenAI provider can now select "Extra High" as a reasoning effort level, enabling maximum reasoning capability for complex tasks (thanks andrewginns!) (#9900)
OpenRouter models that support native tools now automatically use native tool calling by default, improving tool calling reliability without manual configuration. (#9878)

Unified Context-Management UX: Real-time feedback for context operations with truncation notifications and condensation summaries (#9795) Better OpenAI Error Messages: Enhanced error handler extracts detailed information from API errors for easier troubleshooting (#9639) Token Counting Optimization: Removed separate API calls for token counting, improving performance (#9884) Tools Decoupled from System Prompt: Tool-specific instructions are now self-contained in tool descriptions (#9784)

Tool Protocol Selector: Always show tool protocol selector for OpenAI-compatible providers (thanks bozoweed!) (#9966) apply_diff Filtering: Properly exclude apply_diff from native tools when diff is disabled (thanks denis-kudelin!) (#9920) API Timeout Handling: Fixed disabled API timeout (set to 0) causing immediate request failures (thanks dcbartlett!) (#9960) Reasoning Effort Dropdown: Respect explicit supportsReasoningEffort array values and fix disable handling (#9970, #9930) Actual Error Messages: Display actual API error messages instead of generic text on retry (#9954) Stream Hanging Fix: Process finish_reason to emit tool_call_end events for OpenRouter, Roo, and xAI providers (#9927, #9929) tool_result ID Validation: Validate and fix tool_result IDs before API requests to prevent Anthropic rejections (#9952) Suppressed Internal Error: Fixed 'ask promise was ignored' error leaking to LLM conversations (#9914) Provider Sanitization: Fixed infinite loop when using removed/invalid API providers (#9869) Context Icons Theme: Context-management icons now use foreground color to match VSCode themes (#9912) Eval Runs Deletion: Fixed foreign key constraint preventing eval run deletions (#9909) OpenAI-Compatible Timeout Reliability: Added timeout handling to OpenAI-compatible providers to prevent indefinite hangs (thanks dcbartlett!) (#9898)

DeepSeek V3.2: Updated to V3.2 with 50% price reduction, native tools enabled by default, and 8K max output (#9962) xAI Models Catalog: Updated catalog with corrected context windows, image support for grok-3/grok-3-mini, and removed deprecated models (#9872) xAI Tool Preferences: Configured xAI models to use search_replace for better file editing compatibility (#9923) DeepSeek V3.2 for Baseten: Added DeepSeek V3.2 model support (thanks AlexKer!) (#9861) Baseten Model Tweaks: Improved maxTokens limits and native tools support for stability (#9866) Bedrock Models: Added Kimi, MiniMax, and Qwen model configurations (thanks jbearak!) (#9905)

Announcement UI Updates: Improved announcement visuals with updated social icons and GitHub stars CTA (#9945) Improved Error Logging: Better error context for parseToolCall exceptions and cloud job errors (#9857, #9924) search_replace Native Tool: New tool for single-replacement file operations with precise targeting via unique text matching (#9918) Versioned Settings Support: Internal infrastructure for API-side versioning of model settings with minimum plugin version gating (#9934) OpenRouter Telemetry: Added API error telemetry for better diagnostics (#9953) Evals Streaming Stats: Tool usage stats now stream in real-time with token usage throttling (#9926)
This release adds GPT-5.2 model support, a toggle to configure Enter key behavior in chat, and several bug fixes.

GPT-5.2 is now available and set as the default model for the OpenAI provider (#10024): 400K context window 128K max output tokens Configurable reasoning levels (none, low, medium, high, xhigh) 24-hour prompt cache retention

New setting to configure how Enter works in chat input (thanks lmtr0!) (#10002): Default: Enter sends, Shift+Enter for newline Alternative: Enter for newline, Ctrl/Cmd+Enter sends Find it in Settings > UI > Enter Key Behavior. Useful for multiline prompts and CJK input methods where Enter confirms character composition.

Gemini: Fixed reasoning loops and empty response errors (#10007) API errors: Fixed "Expected toolResult blocks at messages" errors during parallel tool execution (#10015) API errors: Fixed ToolResultIdMismatchError when conversation history has orphaned tool_result blocks (#10027)
Z.ai: Added API endpoint options for users on API billing instead of Coding plan (thanks richtong!) (#9894)
Removed deprecated list_code_definition_names tool (#10005)
此版本简化了自动批准设置，改进了通过 OpenRouter 使用 OpenAI 模型的行为，并扩展了 Amazon Bedrock 的选项。
documents.s: Roo Code 3.36.7 版本发布说明 (2025-12-15)

documents.t: 当您通过 OpenRouter 使用 OpenAI 模型时，Roo 现在通过显式启用 apply_patch 并避免使用在该上下文中不受支持的文件写入工具，使工具使用更加可预测 (#10082)。 这减少了不同提供商/模型之间工具可用性差异带来的摩擦，并有助于在编辑过程中避免意外中断。
documents.s: 通过 OpenRouter 使用 OpenAI 模型时的工具支持
documents.h: #通过-openrouter-使用-openai-模型时的工具支持

documents.t: 自动批准不再为 重试失败的请求 和 更新待办事项列表 设置单独的开关——启用自动批准后，重试和待办事项更新将自动运行 (#10062)。 如果您依赖这些单独的开关，这将减少配置开销，并使自动批准行为更易于理解。
模式工具验证更加一致：通过将模式工具可用性检查整合到一处，提高了可靠性 (#10089)

更详细的 OpenRouter 错误报告：捕获更多特定于提供商的错误元数据，使故障更易于诊断 (#10073) AWS Bedrock 服务层级支持：为支持的模型添加了 Bedrock 服务层级选项（标准/灵活/优先）（感谢 Smartsheet-JB-Brown！） (#9955) Bedrock 中的 Amazon Nova 2 Lite：将 Nova 2 Lite 模型添加到 Bedrock 提供商的模型列表中（感谢 Smartsheet-JB-Brown！） (#9830)
改进的 Web 评估运行日志：通过改进运行日志和格式化，使评估运行更易于检查 (#10081)
This release improves follow-up auto-approval behavior, expands tool customization options, and fixes provider settings and error reporting.
Clearer auto-approve timing in follow-up suggestions: Makes the auto-approve countdown harder to miss (#10048)

Auto-approval stops when you start typing: Fixes an issue where an auto-approve timer could still fire after you began writing a response (#9937) More actionable OpenRouter error messages: Fixes an issue where failures could show only generic errors by surfacing upstream details when available (#10039) LiteLLM tool protocol dropdown always appears: Restores the tool protocol dropdown in the provider’s Advanced settings even when LiteLLM model metadata isn’t available yet (#10053) MCP tool calls work with stricter providers: Fixes failures caused by special characters in MCP server/tool names by sanitizing names and using an unambiguous mcp--server--tool ID format (#10054)

Tool aliases for model-specific tool naming: Adds support for alternative tool names so different models can call the same tool using the naming they expect (#9989) Workspace task visibility controls for organizations: Adds an org-level setting for how visible Roo Code Cloud “extension tasks” are across the workspace (#10020)
This release defaults more providers to native tools, improves tool-call reliability across providers, and makes errors easier to debug.

Roo now defaults to the Native tool protocol for more providers—so tool use is more consistent out of the box on: OpenAI Azure OpenAI OpenAI Compatible Anthropic Google Gemini Vertex AI xAI Mistral Groq Amazon Bedrock If you’re already using OpenRouter, you’ve been getting native tool calling by default. This release extends that same default behavior across the providers listed above. You can still switch back to XML tools in your profile’s advanced settings if you need to. (#10059, #10021)
